00001 //_____________________________________________
00002 //
00003 // KRawEvent.cxx
00004 // KDataStructure
00005 //
00006 // Author: Adam Cox <mailto:adam.cox@ik.fzk.de>
00007 //
00008 // * Copyright 2010 Karlsruhe Institute of Technology. All rights reserved.
00009 //
00010 // This is the main Event class for Raw level analysis. One typically
00011 // begins all analysis by getting a pointer to this object from 
00012 // the KDataReader object. By calling KDataReader::GetEntry(Int_t i)
00013 // or KDataReader::GetNextEntry, one can loop through the KDS data
00014 // file and examine each event separately. From this object
00015 // one can obtain pointers to they Muon and Bolometer System Records
00016 // GetBoloSystemRecord(void), GetMuonVetoSystemRecord()
00017 // and to each of the event's Sub Records. The raw level data file
00018 // should contain the bolometer pulse traces for each event.
00019 //
00020 // To allocate memory and get a pointer to an object of this type from the KEventFactory, 
00021 // use the global varaibles
00022 // const Char_t kRawEventName[] = "Raw";
00023 // const Char_t kRawClassName[] = "KRawEvent";
00024 //
00025 // to call
00026 //
00027 // KRawEvent *rawEvent = KEventFactory::NewEvent("Raw");
00028 // KRawEvent *rawEvent = KEventFactory::NewEvent("KRawEvent");
00029 //  
00030 // or, simply use
00031 //
00032 // KRawEvent *rawEvent = KEventFactory::NewRawEvent();
00033 //
00034

00059 KRawEvent& KRawEvent::operator=(const KEvent &anEvent)
00060 {
00061 #ifdef _K_DEBUG_EVENT_ASSIGNOP
00062         cout << "raw = base" << endl;
00063 #endif
00064         if(&anEvent == this) return *this;
00065 
00066         //copy the base class info.
00067         this->KEvent::operator=(anEvent);
00068         
00069         return *this;
00070 }
00071 
00072 KRawEvent& KRawEvent::operator=(const KRawEvent &anEvent)
00073 {
00074 #ifdef _K_DEBUG_EVENT_ASSIGNOP
00075         cout << "raw = raw" << endl;
00076 #endif
00077         if(&anEvent == this) return *this;
00078 
00079         //copy the base class info.
00080         this->KEvent::operator=(anEvent);
00081 
00082         CopyLocalMembers(anEvent);
00083         
00084         return *this;   
00085 }
00086 
00087 KRawEvent& KRawEvent::operator=(const KHLAEvent &anEvent)
00088 {
00089 #ifdef _K_DEBUG_EVENT_ASSIGNOP
00090         cout << "raw = hla" << endl;
00091 #endif
00092         try {
00093                 const KEvent &rhs = dynamic_cast<const KEvent&>(anEvent);
00094                 if(&rhs == this) return *this;
00095                 //copy the base class info.
00096                 this->KEvent::operator=(rhs);
00097 
00098         }
00099         catch (bad_cast) {
00100                 cout << "THROW!" << endl;
00101                 //what should i do? this should never throw!
00102                 throw;  
00103         }
00104         
00105         return *this;
00106 }

00119 void KRawEvent::Clear(Option_t *opt)
00120 {
00121         //Clear the base classes and then clear/delete any local
00122         //members. Its necessary for this Clear method to exist
00123         //in the case that instances of this object are stored
00124         //inside of a TClonesArray
00125         KEvent::Clear(opt);
00126         
00127         //Clear and delete local objects here. 
00128         InitializeMembers();
00129 }

00136 Bool_t KRawEvent::IsSame(const KRawEvent &anEvent, Bool_t bPrint) const
00137 {
00138         //Compares two objects and their member variables to test for equality.
00139         //If bPrint is set to true, then a message for each member variable that is different
00140         //will print to standard out. Otherwise, this method will return false and quit
00141         //checking member variables as soon as it finds a unequal data member.
00142         
00143         Bool_t bIsEqual = true; //assume its true, then test for differences
00144         
00145         //call the base class's IsSame methods
00146         if(!this->KEvent::IsSame(anEvent,bPrint)){
00147                 if (bPrint) 
00148                         bIsEqual = false;
00149                 if(!bPrint)
00150                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00151                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00152         }
00153         
00154         
00155         return bIsEqual;
00156 }

00159 void KRawEvent::Compact(void)
00160 {
00161         //Make the event class as small as possible. this calls 'Compact' for all member
00162         //variables that are KDS classes, member variables that can be compacted (such as TBits)
00163         //and base classes
00164         
00165         KEvent::Compact();
00166 }
